result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brad Bennett was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The fine is $1305.00 due 60 days or pay plan.
DNA surcharge of $200.00 due 60 days or pay plan.
Huber privileges subject to jail policies.  Good time allowed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brad Bennett in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard 15CM650 & 16CM157.   Defendant pleads no contest to count 1 of amended complaint.  Court adjudged guilty and enters JOC.  Court imposes: 22 days jail with huber and good time to begin today at 4:00 pm, $1505.00, 15 month revocation & 15 month ignition interlock, AODA & treatment.  DIsmiss count 2.  1 day jail credit.  In 16CM157: reading waived.  Defendant pleads no contest  to count 1 and count 3 in 16CM157.  Court will adjudge guilty and enter JOC.  On Count 1 court withheld sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  OWI tcourt program. 15 days jail with huber, no good time for those days.150 days jail, imposed and stayed upon completion of OWI court.   $1750.00, 24 month revocation & IID, AODA & treatment.  Huber for treatment court. Sentence withheld on count 2. .  Costs of $243.00.  Count 2 dismissed.

Defendant Brad Bennett in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset requested.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by  ADA Troy Cross
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by  ADA Troy Cross
Copy of Letter from ADA Troy Cross to Atty Michael Hughes re:  Discovery.

not possess/consume alcohol, not go upon premises where alcohol is sold for onsight consumption, not to possess firearms, if defendant has firearms, defendant to turn them over to the Portage Police Dept. upon release from jail

Defendant Brad Bennett in court, in custody by video with attorney Alicia M. Nall.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, $2,000.00 sign bond, not possess/consume alcohol, not go upon premises where alcohol is served for onsight consumption, not to possess firearms, if defendant have firearms, defendant to turn them over to Portage Police Dept. upon release from jail,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
